summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 between attorneys Colleen Mullen and Teri Gibbs (representing a witness) and a government prosecutor (likely from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York). The chain discusses scheduling an interview for a witness who worked for Ghislaine Maxwell and possesses documents, and includes earlier correspondence from 2019-2020 about a different client who witnessed Prince Andrew's interactions with Virginia Giuffre.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Attorney representing a witness (referred to as 'Ms. [Redacted]') who worked for Ghislaine Maxwell and possesses documents. She is coordinating with government prosecutors to facilitate her client's cooperation.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney (also referred to as 'Ted Gibbs' in some emails) working with Colleen Mullen, corresponding with government prosecutors regarding witness interviews and information.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal investigation. The witness represented by Mullen worked for her from 2003-2007 and possesses documents and email correspondence with her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual for whom the witness worked 'by extension' through Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in a separate 2019 email thread where Teri Gibbs offers a client who witnessed his interactions with Virginia Giuffre.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Mentioned in the 2019 email as the individual with whom Prince Andrew's interactions were witnessed by a client of Teri Gibbs.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Mentioned as being available with Teri Gibbs for a call regarding a witness related to Prince Andrew in December 2019.

connections.description: Attorneys working together to represent clients with information relevant to the Epstein/Maxwell investigations.
Mullen represents a witness who was an employee of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The witness worked for Maxwell and, by extension, for Jeffrey Epstein.
A client of Teri Gibbs witnessed interactions between Prince Andrew and Virginia Giuffre.
Mentioned as being available together for a call regarding a witness in the Prince Andrew matter.

events.title: Court Issues Protective Order
events.description: A court issued a protective order and a memorandum & order granting a government motion, attached to the email.

events.title: Email Negotiations for Witness Interview
events.description: Extended email correspondence between attorneys Mullen/Gibbs and government prosecutors to schedule an interview with a witness who worked for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Sharing of Witness Employment Information
events.description: Attorneys share a list of office numbers used by their client during her employment with Ghislaine Maxwell from 2003-2007.

events.title: Offer of Witness on Prince Andrew
events.description: Attorney Teri Gibbs contacts government prosecutors offering a client who witnessed Prince Andrew's interactions with Virginia Giuffre, leading to scheduling discussions.

keyFacts: A witness represented by attorneys Colleen Mullen and Teri Gibbs worked for Ghislaine Maxwell (and by extension, Jeffrey Epstein) from 2003 to 2007 and possesses documents and email correspondence with Maxwell.
The witness is willing to fully cooperate with the criminal investigation against Ghislaine Maxwell and is described as potentially 'a valuable witness.'
The witness's attorneys express deep concern for their client's personal safety and wish to maintain her anonymity during cooperation talks.
In a separate 2019 matter, attorney Teri Gibbs offered a different client who witnessed interactions between Prince Andrew and Virginia Giuffre.
The email chain includes attached court documents from July 2020 regarding a protective order in the Maxwell case.
